definition: to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: What are the legal prospects of the creationist fallback strategy?
sentences.chinese: 創造論者的退守策略在法律上的前景如何？

sentences.english: The battle is going badly for us,we'd better fall back on the town in the hills.
sentences.chinese: 戰鬥對我們越來越不利，我們最好退守到山中的小鎮。

sentences.english: The Gungans retreated to a sacred place within the Naboo swamps.
sentences.chinese: 岡根人退守至納布沼澤羣中的一處聖地內。

sentences.english: Realistic emotion in his poems express both ambitious and conservative attitude.
sentences.chinese: 其詩歌中的現實情思既有用世之志，復多退守之想。

definition: to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
to defend one's property to the death/to cling obstinately to old habits/die-hard
to give up defending/to yield/to surrender
to stand a siege/trapped in a besieged city
to strongly defend one's position/to be entrenched/to cling to
to advance on sth/to press closely (on some goal)
to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
to rely on natural barriers (for one's defense)
(to resist the enemy) relying on inaccessible territory
